Package tournamentmanager.core.api

Interface Game

All Known Implementing Classes:
GameImpl
public interface Game
Represents a game in a Tournament tree. A Game means that there is a confrontation between two participants.

At the beginning, a Game is NOTSTARTED. When the confrontation between two players begins, a Game must be INPROGRESS. Once in progress, points can be given to each player. Once the confrontation is over, the Game must be FINISHED.

  • Method Details

    • addPoints

      void addPoints​(Participant participant, int points) throws TournamentException, IllegalArgumentException
      Give or remove points (with a negative value) to one Participant of the Game.

      Can only be called if the game is INPROGRESS.

      Parameters:
      participant - The Participant to which points must be given.
      points - The points to add (or to remove, using a negative value).
      Throws:
      TournamentException - If the Game is not INPROGRESS.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the given participant is either null or not part of the Game.

    • addPreviousGame

      void addPreviousGame​(Game game) throws IllegalArgumentException, TournamentException
      Adds a previous Game to this Game.

      A previous Game is a Game from the previous round whose winner will become a participant in the current Game.

      There can only be two previous Games max for a Game.

      Can only be used if the Game is NOTSTARTED. Is used to initially construct the Tournament tree.

      Parameters:
      game - The Game to add as a previous Game.
      Throws:
      TournamentException - If there are already two previous Games, or if the Game already part of the previous Games, or if the current Game is not NOTSTARTED.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided Game is null.

    • addParticipant

      void addParticipant​(Participant participant) throws TournamentException
      Add a Participant to the Game. There can only be two participants max for a Game.
      Parameters:
      participant - The participant to add.
      Throws:
      TournamentException - If there are already two participants or if the participant is already part of this Game.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided participant is null.

    • start

      void start() throws TournamentException
      Sets the status to INPROGRESS.

      Once a game has started, points can be given to players.

      Throws:
      TournamentException - If the game has already started, or if the game does not have two participants.

    • getPreviousGames

      List<Game> getPreviousGames()
      Retrieve the previous Games of this Game, ie. the Games whose winners will be participants in the current Game. If this Game is in the first round, returns an empty list.
      Returns:
      The previous Games of this Game.

    • finish

      void finish() throws TournamentException
      Set the status to FINISHED.

      Once finished, a Game cannot be edited anymore, the winner is automatically added as a participant in the following Game. and the loser is set to eliminated from the tournament.

      Can only be called if the status is INPROGRESS, and if the scores are not ex-aequo.

      Throws:
      TournamentException - If the status is not INPROGRESS, or if the scores are ex-aequo.

    • getStatus

      Status getStatus()
      Retrieve the status of the Game.
      Returns:
      The status of the Game.

    • getParticipants

      List<Participant> getParticipants()
      Retrieve the participants of the Game (max 2).
      Returns:
      The participants of the Game.

    • getWinner

      Participant getWinner() throws TournamentException
      Retrieve the winner of the Game.

      Must be called when there is a winner (for instance if a game is finished).

      Returns:
      The winner of this game.
      Throws:
      TournamentException - If there is no winner yet.

    • getLoser

      Participant getLoser() throws TournamentException
      Retrieve the loser of the Game, if any.

      Must be called when there is a loser (for instance if a game is finished).

      Returns:
      The loser of this Game.
      Throws:
      TournamentException - If there is no loser yet.

    • getFollowingGame

      Optional<Game> getFollowingGame()
      Retrieve the following Game, which is the Game where the winner of this Game will go. If this Game is the final Game, then returns an empty Optional.
      Returns:
      The following Game where the winner will go.

    • setFollowingGame

      void setFollowingGame​(Game game) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Sets the following Game of this Game, ie. the Game where the winner of this current Game will go.
      Parameters:
      game - The Game to set as following Game.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided Game is null.
